Name

InsightSquared

InsightSquared is one word with both the "I" and "S" capitalized.

Insightsquared

The “s”, in “squared” should be capitalized.

Insight Squared

InsightSquared is one word, not two.

Logo

Our logo is the face of InsightSquared, please only use the logo's provided here and never modify them.

PNG EPS
PNG EPS
PNG EPS

Vertical logo

PNG EPS
PNG EPS

Clear space

There should always be ample space around the logo to ensure maximum impact and keep the mark from looking cluttered.

Improper logo useage

Improper useage of our logo weakens our brand and reflects poorly on the business.

Don't stretch or skew the logo.

Don't stretch or skew the logo.

Don't use the old logo (The old logo's symbol has fills).

Don't change the color of the logo.

Don't add drop shadows, blur, or any other effects.

Don't rotate the logo vertically.

Color

The primary color palette is blue, black and gray, all other colors are accents. A minimal palette, with our blue as the primary color, good information design, and ample whitespace will ensure a voice of authority and expertise in communication.

Typography

Clear typography is critical to the effective communication of our brand. It should promote readability and accessibility, which allows all users to efficiently read and absorb textual information.

Typeface

Roboto is the primary brand typeface and can be used across all formats from print to digital. Roboto has a dual nature. It has a mechanical skeleton and the forms are largely geometric. At the same time, the font features friendly and open curves.

Roboto Light

Type Hierarchy

Hierarchy refers to the difference in type size and weight between text elements. It creates focus points that signal the user where to read; a successful hierarchy enables readers to easily scan content. Robot is used for all title weights while Helevetica Neue is used for body copy and smaller.

Display

44pt Roboto Black / 54pt leading / 25pt tracking

Heading 1

30pt Roboto Medium / 40pt leading

Heading 2

24pt Roboto Medium / 34pt leading

Heading 3

20pt Roboto Medium / 30pt leading

Heading 4

18pt Roboto Medium / 28pt leading

Heading 5

14pt Roboto Bold / All Caps / 24pt leading / 50pt tracking

Body copy
16pt Helvetica Neue Regular / 24pt leading

.display {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 2.75rem;
font-weight: 900;
letter-spacing: 0.0625rem;
}
h1 {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 1.875rem;
font-weight: 500;
}
h2 {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 1.5rem;
font-weight: 500;
}
h3 {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 1.25rem;
font-weight: 500;
}
h4 {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 1.125rem;
font-weight: 500;
}
h5 {
font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 0.875rem;
font-weight: 700;
letter-spacing: 0.0625rem;
text-transform: uppercase;
}
p {
font-family: 'Helvetica', Arial, sans-serif;
font-weight: 400;
font-size: 1rem;
}

Icons

Buttons

Buttons signal actions. They should be used sparingly; each additional button on a page reduces the visual prominence of a call to action.

Button Sizing

Tiny Button Small Button Default Button Disabled Button Large Button Expanded Button

Button Colors

Default Button Success Button Secondary Button Alert Button Info Button Disabled Button

Inputs

Consistent input elements help us quickly design effective web forms.

Text inputs

Single-Line
Multi-Line

States

Focus
Error
Success
